summary: This is the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust Agreement, dated January 18, 2019, which revokes the 2018 trust. It establishes Epstein as the Grantor, with Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as Trustees. The document details extensive bequests to numerous individuals upon Epstein's death, including large annuities and cash gifts, and outlines complex trust structures for managing his properties and assets.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator of the trust, who reserves extensive rights to amend, revoke, and withdraw assets during his lifetime, and designates numerous beneficiaries in his will.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named as a Trustee of the 2019 Trust, responsible for administering the trust assets. He is also a significant beneficiary, slated to receive $20,000,000 and have certain debts forgiven.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Named as a Trustee of the 2019 Trust, responsible for administering the trust assets. He is also a significant beneficiary, slated to receive $20,000,000 and have certain debts forgiven.

connections.description: Epstein is the Grantor and Indyke is a Trustee and long-time financial advisor/associate. The trust designates Indyke as a major beneficiary and outlines complex financial dealings between them and their entities.

Epstein is the Grantor and Kahn is a Trustee and long-time financial advisor/associate. The trust designates Kahn as a major beneficiary and outlines complex financial dealings between them and their entities.
Fern Sajpher is referenced as the potential spouse of Darren Keith Indyke, and a $3,000,000 bequest is contingent on her being married to him at Epstein's death.
Lisa Kahn is referenced as the spouse of Richard David Kahn in clauses regarding the forgiveness of debts owed to Epstein's entities.
Dubin is the primary residual beneficiary of the trust, slated to receive major properties (islands, ranch) and the bulk of the remaining estate in complex trust structures.
Both serve as co-Trustees of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust, jointly responsible for its administration.

events.title: Execution of Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein, Darren K. Indyke, and Richard D. Kahn sign the trust agreement, revoking the 2018 trust and establishing new terms for the management and distribution of Epstein's assets upon his death.

events.title: Revocation of 2018 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement explicitly revokes 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust' previously created by Epstein, stating it shall have no force and effect as of the execution date of this 2019 agreement.

locations: Little St. James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
Great St. James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein created a new trust on January 18, 2019, just months before his death, revoking a 2018 trust.
The trust designates Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as Trustees and major beneficiaries, each slated to receive $20,000,000 and have their debts to Epstein's entities forgiven.

Celina Edith Dubin is named as the primary residual beneficiary, set to inherit Epstein's infamous properties including Little St. James and Great St. James islands, Zorro Ranch, and the residuary estate.
The document contains numerous bequests of annuities and cash gifts to individuals, many with redacted names, including one bequest of $100,000,000 to a redacted individual.

The trust includes a 'spendthrift' provision and a 'no contest' clause, and is governed by the laws of the U.S. Virgin Islands, with provisions allowing the Trustees to move the trust's situs to another jurisdiction.
